    version: 0.9

    Nav

    Defines different styles for list navigations.

    Usage

    To apply this component, use the following classes.

    Class Description
    .nav Add this class to a <ul> element to define the Nav component. Use <a> elements as nav items within the list.
    .active Add this class to a list item to apply an active state to a menu item. 
    
<ul class="nav">
	<li class="active"><a href=""></a></li>
	<li><a href=""></a></li>
</ul>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Item
    • Item
    
<ul class="nav nav-default">
	<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
	<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
	<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
</ul>

    Note By default, the nav has no styling. That's why it is important to add a modifier class. In our example we are using the .nav-default class.

    Nested navs

    Add the .parent class to an item to turn it into a parent. Add the .nav-sub class to a <ul> element inside the item to create the subnav.

    
<ul class="nav">
	<li class="parent">
		<a href=""></a>
		<ul class="nav-sub">
			<li><a href=""></a></li>
			<li>
				<a href=""></a>
				<ul>…</ul>
			</li>
		</ul>
	</li>
</ul>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
        • Sub item
        • Sub item
    
<div class="width-1-2@s width-2-5@m">
	<ul class="nav nav-default">
		<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
		<li class="parent">
			<a href="#">Parent</a>
			<ul class="nav-sub">
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
				<li>
					<a href="#">Sub item</a>
					<ul>
						<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
						<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
					</ul>
				</li>
			</ul>
		</li>
	</ul>
</div>

    Parent icon

    To create a parent icon, just add the nav-parent-icon attribute to a <span> element.

    
<ul class="nav nav-default">
	<li>
		<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">chevron_down</span></a>
		…
	</li>
</ul>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
        • Sub item
        • Sub item
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
    
<ul class="nav nav-default">
	<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
	<li>
		<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">keyboard_arrow_down</span></a>
		<ul class="nav-sub">
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			<li>
				<a href="#">Sub item</a>
				<ul>
					<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
					<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
				</ul>
			</li>
		</ul>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">keyboard_arrow_down</span></a>
		<ul class="nav-sub">
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
		</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

    Multiple open subnavs

    When clicking on a parent item, an open one will close, allowing only one open nested list at a time. To allow multiple open subnavs, just add the data-multiple attribute to the nav component.

    
<ul class="nav nav-default" data-multiple>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
        • Sub item
        • Sub item
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
    
<ul class="nav nav-default" data-multiple>
	<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
	<li>
		<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">keyboard_arrow_down</span></a>
		<ul class="nav-sub">
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			<li>
				<a href="#">Sub item</a>
				<ul>
					<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
					<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
				</ul>
			</li>
		</ul>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">keyboard_arrow_down</span></a>
		<ul class="nav-sub">
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
		</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

    Open Nav

    By default, nav component behaves like accordion. To stop this and make nav always open, just add the data-open attribute to the main <ul>.

    
<ul class="nav nav-default" data-open>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
        • Sub item
        • Sub item
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
    
<ul class="nav nav-default" data-open>
	<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
	<li>
		<a href="#">Parent</a>
		<ul class="nav-sub">
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			<li>
				<a href="#">Sub item</a>
				<ul>
					<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
					<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
				</ul>
			</li>
		</ul>
	</li>
	<li>
		<a href="#">Parent</a>
		<ul class="nav-sub">
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
		</ul>
	</li>
</ul>

    Header and divider

    Add one of the following classes to a list item to create a header or a divider between items.

    Element Description
    .nav-header Add this class to a <li> element to create a header.
    .nav-divider Add this class to a <li> element to create a divider separating nav items. 
    
<li class="nav-header"></li>

<li class="nav-divider"></li>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Header
    • Item
    • Item
    • Item
    
<div class="width-1-2@s width-2-5@m">
	<ul class="nav nav-default">
		<li class="nav-header">Header</li>
		<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
		<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
		<li class="nav-divider"></li>
		<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
	</ul>
</div>

    Subtitle

    Add the .nav-subtitle class to a div element to create an item subtitled.

    
<ul class="nav">
	<li>
		<a href="">
			<div>
				Item
				<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div>
			</div>
		</a>
	</li>
</ul>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
      Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.
    • Item
      Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.
    • Item
      Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.
    • Item
      Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.
    
<div class="width-1-2@s width-2-5@m">
	<ul class="nav nav-default">
		<li class="active"><a href="#"><div>Active<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div></div></a></li>
		<li><a href="#"><div>Item<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div></div></a></li>
		<li><a href="#"><div>Item<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div></div></a></li>
		<li><a href="#"><div>Item<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</div>

    Default modifier

    Add the .nav-default class to give the nav its default style. You can place the nav inside cards or anywhere else in your content.

    
<ul class="nav nav-default">…</ul>
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
    • Header
    • Item
    • Item
    • Item 
    
<div class="card card-default card-body width-1-2@s round">
	<ul class="nav nav-default">
		<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
		<li>
			<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">keyboard_arrow_down</span></a>
			<ul class="nav-sub">
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			</ul>
		</li>
		<li>
			<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">keyboard_arrow_down</span></a>
			<ul class="nav-sub">
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			</ul>
		</li>
		<li class="nav-header">Header</li>
		<li><a href="#"><span class="margin-small-right icon">menu</span> Item</a></li>
		<li><a href="#"><span class="margin-small-right icon">grid_view</span> Item</a></li>
		<li class="nav-divider"></li>
		<li><a href="#"><span class="margin-small-right icon">delete</span> Item</a></li>
	</ul>
</div>

    Primary modifier

    Add the .nav-primary class to give the nav a more distinct styling, for example when placing it inside a modal.

    
<ul class="nav nav-primary">
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
    • Parent
      • Sub item
      • Sub item
    • Item
    
<div class="width-1-2@s">
	<ul class="nav nav-primary">
		<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
		<li>
			<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">keyboard_arrow_down</span></a>
			<ul class="nav-sub">
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			</ul>
		</li>
		<li>
			<a href="#">Parent <span class="icon nav-parent-icon">keyboard_arrow_down</span></a>
			<ul class="nav-sub">
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
				<li><a href="#">Sub item</a></li>
			</ul>
		</li>
		<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
	</ul>
</div>

    Secondary modifier

    Add the .nav-secondary class to have an extra style if the nav has subtitles.

    
<ul class="nav nav-secondary">
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
      Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.
    • Item
      Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.
    • Item
      Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.
    • Item
      Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.
    
<div class="width-1-2@s">
	<ul class="nav nav-secondary">
		<li class="active"><a href="#"><div>Active<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div></div></a></li>
		<li><a href="#"><div>Item<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div></div></a></li>
		<li><a href="#"><div>Item<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div></div></a></li>
		<li><a href="#"><div>Item<div class="nav-subtitle">Subtitle lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do.</div></div></a></li>
	</ul>
</div>

    Center modifier

    Add the .nav-center class to the center nav items. This can be combined with the default and primary style modifiers.

    
<ul class="nav nav-default nav-center">
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Item
    • Item
    
<div class="card card-default card-body width-1-2@s round">
	<ul class="nav nav-default nav-center">
		<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
		<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
		<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
	</ul>
</div>

    Divider modifier

    Add the .nav-divider class to separate nav items with lines. This can be combined with the default, primary and secondary style modifiers.

    
<ul class="nav nav-default nav-divider">
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Item
    • Item
    
<div class="width-1-2@s">
	<ul class="nav nav-default nav-divider">
		<li class="active"><a href="#">Active</a></li>
		<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
		<li><a href="#">Item</a></li>
	</ul>
</div>

    Size modifiers

    Add one of the following classes to modify the size of primary navs.

    Class Description
    .nav-medium Add this class to apply a medium-sized primary nav.
    .nav-large Add this class to apply a large-sized primary nav.
    .nav-xlarge Add this class to apply a xlarge-sized primary nav.
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Item
    • Item
    • Item

    Nav in Dropdown

    Add the .dropdown-nav class to place a nav inside a default dropdown from the Dropdown component.
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Active
    • Item
    • Header
    • Item
    • Item
    • Item

    Nav in Navbar

    Add the .navbar-dropdown-nav class to place the nav inside a navbar dropdown from the Navbar component.
    • Preview
    • Markup
    • Parent
      • Active
      • Item
      • Header
      • Item
      • Item
      • Item

    Nav in offcanvas

    A nav can be used inside an offcanvas from the Offcanvas component. No modifier class needs to be added.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Open
    • Active
    • Item
    • Header
    • Item
    • Item
    • Item
